description: Another exploration off the Gairloch Mountain Rd is on a tributary to MacKenzie Brook.  A nice logging road gets you very close to the brook.  The only thing I had was some sat imagery that looked promising.  I set forth into a logged area overgrown by prickly bushes but son was in a mature hardwood forest.  I followed the tributary and was soon rewarded by a series of fall at; N46.14625° W61.00825°.Going further downstream you will some ore smaller falls until the largest of all of the falls on this brook at; N46.14879° W61.00391°.  Here the tributary flows into the MacKenzie Brook and a nice rock wall can be seen across the brook. I followed the brook upstream for about 100ft to a smaller fall on the larger brook.  After I went up the hill and returned to my car via a super nice hardwood stand.Stats for the hike; 3.3km, 1hr7min, 980ft total elevation
directions: West Middle River Rd.  Turn on Gairloch Mtn road and follow it until intersection at; N46.12949° W61.00296°.  Turn right and follow it until you park approximately at; N46.14659° W61.01449°
title: MacKenzie Tributary Brook Fall
